Content.Title: International Pathway Admission
Content.Abstract: Admission requirements for BYU-Idaho's Pathway International program.
Content.BodyCopy:
Required Application Materials

  • Part 1 - Student Information
  • Part 2 - School Selection
  • Part 4 - Pathway Institute Recommendation
  • Based upon the recommendation of the participating Institute Director or Pathway personnel, an English proficiency assessment may be required.

Who can apply?

The Pathway Program is available to members of the Church who:

  • 18 to 30 years old (30+ program in selected locations)
  • Daily access to computer with high-speed internet
  • Minimum of Intermediate-Low English proficiency (~4 on a 9 pt. scale)*
  • Strives to live by BYU-Idaho's Honor Code
  • Attends Institute weekly
  • Married or Single
  • Member of the Church
* Proficiency test required.  English Language Resources

Where do I begin?

Start by visiting the location page of your nearest Pathway site to see if there is a cohort starting in your area. If you meet the basic eligibility requirements and wish to apply, complete the following steps:

  1. Download a step by step tutorial (requires Adobe Reader)
  2. Go to www.besmart.com
  3. Click "Apply Online"
  4. Create a Net-ID and password (we encourage you to use the same user name and password for BeSmart and  BYU-Idaho to avoid confusion).
  5. After choosing BYU-Idaho as your school select "Online."
  6. Begin the application process by completing steps 1-3.
  7. Submit the application online.
  8. Go back to the application to check your status for completeness.
  9. Check your email for further updates.

For admissions questions regarding the Pathway program please call the Admissions Office at  208-496-1300 or email us: admissions@byui.edu. You can even chat with us online.

What standards must I commit to?

BYU-Idaho and Institutes of Religion are committed to providing an education and atmosphere consistent with the ideals and principles of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. A learning atmosphere is created and preserved through conduct that reflects the ideals and principles of the gospel. During the Academic Start program students are encouraged to begin preparing to live the BYU-Idaho Honor Code. Once students apply to BYU-Idaho as a degree-seeking student, they are expected to commit to live by the BYU-Idaho Honor Code and submit a continuing ecclesiastical endorsement at the beginning of each year.

When should I apply?

International students are admitted into the Fall, Spring or Winter semesters. Applications for fall semester should be submitted before August 1st, winter applications by November 1st and spring applications by April 1st.

Do I need to take the ACT/SAT/TOEFL or verify GED prior to applying?

Students are not required to take any standardized test for acceptance to the Academic Start level of the Pathway Program. However, a language proficiency test is required. All students must maintain a 'B' average to be considered for advancement into a degree program.

Can I go to school on the Rexburg Campus?

After completion of Academic Start (the first year) students can apply to the Online Degree program and continue to take course at the reduce tuition rate, or students can apply to attend on the Rexburg campus. It is important to note, however, that if students attend on campus they must pay the campus tuition rate instead of the Pathway rate. International students must have a current visa, unless they arrived in the U.S. with their parents before the age of eighteen.
